awd_titl_txt: Development and Experimental Verification of a Practical    Robust Control Technique for Flexible Mechanical Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This project addresses the development of a practical robust                    control technique for flexible mechanical systems with an                       infinite number of vibration modes.  The technique uses                         approximate models for control analysis and design, but purports                to guarantee closed loop performance for the infinite order                     closed loop system.  It is based on an approach developed for                   single-input single-output cases, and intends to show that the                  Nyquist plot of the infinite dimensional system lies within a                   certain error bound about a known, approximate, and easy to                     compute plot.  Based on such plots, the performance of a                        particular design will be guaranteed within a certain bound                     related to the approximation error.  The technique will be                      experimentally verified.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
